banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: "The Coming Out Beauty" / "419 sq ft"

nodes.whoTheyAre: Muslim Sahib has always had a flare for theater. He was first introduced to performance poetry through Sarah Kay’s performance at TED. He began exploring the art to find his own voice, and soon discovered poets like Maya Angelou and Andrea Gibson. After many years of writing, Sahib started to perform at poetry slams and open mic events in Singapore, which led to performances at Lit-Up Indie Arts Festival and Singapore Writers Festival. In 2016, Sahib was a curator and editor for the anthology Rollercoasters & Bedsheets. He is also part of the poetry troop Ministry of Noise which performs poetry shows with Arts House and the Substation. Sahib works in the Customer Solutions Group at UPS.

videoData.description: In his poem "The Coming Out Beauty," Muslim Sahib invites us along on his journey of self-love and self-acceptance, weaving together elements of culture, family, beauty and queerness. He compels the audience to proclaim "I am beautiful," encouraging them to celebrate self-love. In his second piece, "419 sq ft," he explores the experience of claiming and occupying space in an often confining world.
